definition: lit. breeze is still, waves are quiet (idiom); tranquil environment/all is quiet/a dead calm (at sea)
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: Life just like an ocean, not always calm maybe paradises sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 生活就像大海不总是风平浪静也有惊涛骇浪时。

sentences.english: Before most big storms there is that moment of calm.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数暴风来临之前总有一段时间风平浪静。

sentences.english: Endure a calm, step back broad sky.
sentences.chinese: 忍一时风平浪静，退一步海阔天空。

sentences.english: Step back and calm, a sports.
sentences.chinese: 退一步风平浪静，忍一时海阔天空。

sentences.english: True Nobility In a calm sea every man is a pilot.
sentences.chinese: 风平浪静的大海，每个人都是领航员。

sentences.english: Such a boat is fit only for a calm sea.
sentences.chinese: 这种船只适于在风平浪静的海上航行。

sentences.english: The battle against the green-eyed monster is hard enough at the best of times .
sentences.chinese: 平日里风平浪静的时候和嫉妒作斗争就已经够艰难了。

sentences.english: In a calm sea every man is a pilot.
sentences.chinese: 风平浪静的大海，每个人都是领航员。

sentences.english: Seas were calm and within a short time turned azure blue in color.
sentences.chinese: 海上风平浪静，海水很快就变成了蔚蓝色。

sentences.english: The true nobility is in being superior to your previous self. What's your opinion?
sentences.chinese: 在风平浪静的大海上，每个人都是领航员。

sentences.english: "Three Line", seemingly the most unusual terrain and calm passions Chung.
sentences.chinese: “三点一线”，看似寻常最崎岖，风平浪静涌激情。
今天是个风平浪静的日子。

sentences.english: In a calm sea every man is a pilot.
sentences.chinese: 在风平浪静的海面上，每一个人都可以成为领航员。

sentences.english: They might be wary that you'll be overextending yourself.
sentences.chinese: 他们可能担心过多就会风平浪静。

sentences.english: Of those calm solitudes is there.
sentences.chinese: 风平浪静地在那里独居良久。

sentences.english: Endure a moment, calm, step back, a brighter future.
sentences.chinese: 忍一时，风平浪静，退一步，海阔天空。

definition: one climax follows another (of thrilling story)
billows/great waves (fig. of a story with great momentum)
moderate wind, beautiful sun (idiom); fine sunny weather, esp. in springtime
lit. large waves in windless conditions (idiom)/fig. trouble arising unexpectedly
